flags.title: Unlimited Liability Exposure
flags.description: The contract does not contain a limitation of liability clause, potentially exposing QDB to unlimited damages in case of breach or negligence by the Supplier.
flags.recommendation: Incorporate a limitation of liability clause that caps the Supplier's liability, ideally to the value of the contract or a defined amount, and exclude certain liabilities like gross negligence or willful misconduct.

flags.title: Unclear Intellectual Property Ownership
flags.description: The contract does not specify who owns the intellectual property (IP) created by the Supplier during the performance of services. Deliverables should be owned by QDB.
flags.recommendation: Add a clause explicitly stating that all IP rights, including copyrights, patents, and trade secrets, developed or created by the Supplier in connection with this Agreement shall belong exclusively to QDB upon full payment.

flags.title: Missing Indemnification Clause
flags.description: The contract lacks an indemnification clause. QDB is not protected from third-party claims arising from the Supplier's actions or omissions.
flags.recommendation: Include an indemnification clause where the Supplier agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless QDB from any and all claims, damages, liabilities, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys' fees) arising out of or related to the Supplier's performance under this Agreement or its breach of any warranties or representations.

flags.title: Missing Confidentiality/Non-Disclosure Clause
flags.description: The agreement does not include a confidentiality clause, leaving sensitive information shared between QDB and Supplier unprotected.
flags.recommendation: Insert a comprehensive confidentiality clause that defines confidential information, outlines obligations of both parties regarding its use and disclosure, and specifies the duration of confidentiality obligations.

flags.title: Missing Termination Rights
flags.description: The contract does not define the conditions or procedures under which either party can terminate the agreement, leaving significant uncertainty.
flags.recommendation: Add clauses detailing termination rights, including termination for cause (e.g., material breach) and termination for convenience (if desired), along with notice periods and consequences of termination.

flags.title: Missing Dispute Resolution Clause
flags.description: There is no clause specifying how disputes arising under the contract will be resolved, which can lead to costly and time-consuming litigation.
flags.recommendation: Include a dispute resolution clause outlining the preferred method(s), such as negotiation, mediation, arbitration, or litigation, and specify the venue.

flags.title: Missing Force Majeure Clause
flags.description: The absence of a force majeure clause means there's no clear provision for unforeseen events that may prevent performance.
flags.recommendation: Incorporate a force majeure clause that excuses non-performance due to events beyond a party's reasonable control (e.g., natural disasters, acts of war), and outlines notice requirements and mitigation obligations.

flags.title: Governing Law Matches Target Jurisdiction
flags.description: The governing law is specified as 'laws of Qatar', which aligns with the target jurisdiction of QATAR.
flags.recommendation: No action needed. This aligns with the target jurisdiction.

flags.title: Unfair Termination Rights (None Specified)
flags.description: The contract does not specify any termination rights for either party. While not inherently unfair, the absence of defined rights can lead to one-sided outcomes if a dispute arises.
flags.recommendation: As noted in the 'Missing Termination Rights' flag, add provisions for termination for cause and potentially for convenience, ensuring fairness and clarity for both parties.

flags.title: Missing Warranties
flags.description: The contract does not include any express warranties from the Supplier regarding the quality of services or deliverables. There is also no disclaimer of 'as-is' conditions.
flags.recommendation: Add specific warranties from the Supplier, such as warranties of professional performance, conformity to specifications, and freedom from defects. Clarify that services will be provided in a professional and workmanlike manner.

flags.title: Payment Terms - Potential Cash Flow Strain
flags.description: Payment is due net 60 days from invoice date upon completion of services. This might be a strain on Supplier's cash flow depending on project duration and timing of invoice.
flags.recommendation: Review if the net 60 days payment term is acceptable for QDB's cash flow. Consider if partial payments or milestone-based payments are more appropriate, especially for longer projects.

flags.title: Data Protection
flags.description: The contract does not mention GDPR or other data privacy regulations. Assuming QDB is a Qatari entity and Supplier is also operating within Qatar, specific data privacy clauses might be required under Qatari law, but likely not GDPR unless cross-border data transfer or EU citizen data is involved.
flags.recommendation: Verify if Qatari data protection laws require specific clauses given the nature of services. If personal data of EU citizens will be processed, GDPR compliance clauses would be essential.

flags.title: Vague Obligations - Services
flags.description: The contract mentions 'completion of services' but does not define the scope, deliverables, or performance standards of these services. This can lead to disputes about what constitutes completion.
flags.recommendation: Attach a detailed Statement of Work (SOW) or Scope of Services as an exhibit to the agreement, clearly outlining all tasks, deliverables, timelines, and acceptance criteria.
flags.clause_reference: PAYMENT TERMS (Implicitly refers to 'completion of services')

recommendations: Add clauses detailing termination rights, including termination for cause (e.g., material breach) and termination for convenience (if desired), along with notice periods and consequences of termination.
